Answer: Making a 3D printer that could print a 3D printer was the end goal of the RepRap project, who spent a long time trying to device a 3D printer what could be built using only parts made on a 3D printer, as well as figuring out how to increase the range of materials which a 3D printer could print. This project had a large hand in the development of much of the technology in modern low-end 3D printers, including a lot of the research that went into the nozzles and filament drive mechanism. But the Reprap project was ultimately a failure, and never really got all that close to a completely printedMaking a 3D printer that could print a 3D printer was the end goal of the RepRap project, who spent a long time trying to device a 3D printer what could be built using only parts made on a 3D printer, as well as figuring out how to increase the range of materials which a 3D printer could print. This project had a large hand in the development of much of the technology in modern low-end 3D printers, including a lot of the research that went into the nozzles and filament drive mechanism. But the Reprap project was ultimately a failure, and never really got all that close to a completely printed printer.One major challenge is the materials. It’s not hard to print the major structural elements, but 3D printed bearings and linear guides don’t work very well, and there’s just no good way to print a microcontroller or a motor at the moment. There’s also the issue of the extruder nozzle, which has to be harder and withstand higher temperatures than the materials it’s printing, so there’s no way to print it with itself.Your application would also have problems with print accuracy. All printers have a limit to the accuracy of the parts they print. A printer’s accuracy is limited by the accuracy of the parts it was printed with. With a normal hand-assembled printer you can hand-tune for better accuracy, but printers which blindly make more printers without assistance are going to have worse accuracy in every generation. That problem gets even worse if each generation is smaller, as the accuracy errors will get much worse with each iteration there.
